Package zuul.pkg_command

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • zuul.pkg_command.Command
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AleaCommand, BackCommand, DropCommand, GoCommand, HelpCommand, ItemCommand, LoadCommand, LookCommand, QuitCommand, TakeCommand, TalkCommand, TestCommand, UnknownCommand, UseCommand
    public abstract class Command
extends Object
    A command represents a particular instruction asked by the user. This takes the form of two separate words, one for the command and a second one for the argument.
    Version:
    06.04.21
    Author:
    Corentin POUPRY

      • Command

        public Command​(String pName,
               boolean pIsTestCommand)
        Creates a new command object.
        Parameters:
        pName - Name of the command.
        pIsTestCommand - true if the command is only intended to be used in test context, false otherwise.

    • Method Detail

      • getSecondWord

        public String getSecondWord()
        Gets the second word.
        Returns:
        the second word.

      • setSecondWord

        public void setSecondWord​(String pSecondWord)
        Define the second word of this command (the word entered after the command word). Null indicates that there was no second word.
        Parameters:
        pSecondWord - The second word.

      • hasSecondWord

        public boolean hasSecondWord()
        Checks if a command has a second word
        Returns:
        true if the command has a second word, false otherwise.

      • execute

        public abstract void execute​(GameEngine pGameEngine,
                             Player pPlayer,
                             UserInterface pInterface)
                      throws Exception
        Execute the command.
        Parameters:
        pGameEngine - The game engine.
        pPlayer - The player using the command.
        pInterface - The user interface used by the game.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the command execution fail.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Gets the command name.
        Returns:
        The command name.

      • isExecutableWhen

        public boolean isExecutableWhen​(boolean pTestMode)
        Checks if the command can be executed in the current mode.
        Parameters:
        pTestMode - true if the test environment is enabled, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the command can be used, false otherwise.
